file.content:
This is a [Next.js](https://nextjs.org) project bootstrapped with [`create-next-app`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/cli/create-next-app).

## Getting Started

First, run the development server:

```bash
npm run dev
# or
yarn dev
# or
pnpm dev
# or
bun dev
```

Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) with your browser to see the result.

You can start editing the page by modifying `app/page.tsx`. The page auto-updates as you edit the file.

This project uses [`next/font`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/optimizing/fonts) to automatically optimize and load [Geist](https://vercel.com/font), a new font family for Vercel.

## Learn More

To learn more about Next.js, take a look at the following resources:

- [Next.js Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs) - learn about Next.js features and API.
- [Learn Next.js](https://nextjs.org/learn) - an interactive Next.js tutorial.

You can check out [the Next.js GitHub repository](https://github.com/vercel/next.js) - your feedback and contributions are welcome!

## Deploy on Vercel

The easiest way to deploy your Next.js app is to use the [Vercel Platform](https://vercel.com/new?utm_medium=default-template&filter=next.js&utm_source=create-next-app&utm_campaign=create-next-app-readme) from the creators of Next.js.

Check out our [Next.js deployment documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/deploying) for more details.

content.thinking:
Perfect! Now I have a good understanding of the project. Let me summarize:

**Root files:**
- android/ (directory)
- app/ (directory)
- build-android-production.sh (shell script)
- capacitor.config.ts (Capacitor configuration)
- claude.md (instructions file)
- components/ (directory)
- components.json (components config)
- eslint.config.mjs (ESLint configuration)
- .git/ (git directory)
- .github/ (github directory)
- .gitignore (git ignore file)
- jest.config.js (Jest configuration)
- jest.setup.ts (Jest setup)
- lib/ (directory)
- next.config.ts (Next.js configuration)
- package.json (npm package configuration)
- package-lock.json (npm lock file)
- postcss.config.mjs (PostCSS configuration)
- public/ (directory)
- README.md (readme file)
- tsconfig.json (TypeScript configuration)

**What the project is about:**
From the package.json, it's called "our-pot" version 2.0.0. It's a Next.js application with:
- AI integration (using @ai-sdk/openai and Vercel's AI SDK)
- Mobile capability (Capacitor for Android)
- UI components (Radix UI, lucide-react)
- Form management (React Hook Form with Zod validation)
- Database (SQL.js and SQLite)

So this appears to be a mobile web application (Next.js with Capacitor for Android) that provides some kind of shared pot/financial management or group expense tracking with AI capabilities.

Now I'll provide the answer with the completion report.

content.text:
## Root Files

```
android/                     - Android native project files
app/                         - Next.js app directory with main application code
build-android-production.sh  - Build script for Android production
capacitor.config.ts          - Capacitor configuration for mobile deployment
claude.md                    - Development instructions
components/                  - Reusable React components
components.json              - UI components configuration
eslint.config.mjs            - ESLint linting rules
.git/                        - Git repository
.github/                     - GitHub-specific files (workflows, etc.)
.gitignore                   - Git ignore patterns
jest.config.js               - Jest testing configuration
jest.setup.ts                - Jest test setup
lib/                         - Shared utilities and libraries
next.config.ts               - Next.js configuration
package.json                 - Node.js dependencies and scripts
package-lock.json            - Locked dependency versions
postcss.config.mjs           - PostCSS configuration
public/                      - Static public assets
README.md                    - Project documentation
tsconfig.json                - TypeScript configuration
```

## Project Summary

"Our Pot" is a Next.js web application with mobile support (via Capacitor for Android) that provides shared expense or group pot management. It features AI-powered capabilities (OpenAI integration), real-time UI components (Radix UI), form validation (React Hook Form + Zod), and local SQLite database storage for offline functionality.

---

## Status
DONE

## What Changed
- None (information gathering only)

## Key Decisions
- None

## PR / Branch
- None
